DOC.brief_title: C.A.T.C.H.-I.T.Competent Adulthood Transition With Cognitive , Humanistic Interpersonal Teaching
DOC.detailed_description: Our study goal develop prototype combination primary care-web base depression intervention young adult age 18-24years urban community university setting . The content development include : ( 1 ) two brief ( 15 minute ) primary care counseling session , ( 2 ) one introductory web base module , ( 3 ) four web-based cognitive behavior teach module , ( 4 ) three web-based module discuss relationship building skill ( IPT ) , ( 5 ) final web module discuss self-recognition , evidence-based treatment , stigma . Eight young adult volunteer evaluate program three loop evaluation revision modify focus group approach . This protocol approve Johns Hopkins Joint Committee Clinical Investigations . Primary Outcomes : The primary outcome variable relate functionality acceptability intervention . These variable include readability , ease understanding , acceptability , helpfulness component intervention , global rating Secondary Outcomes : Process measure ( time site , exercise completion ) , outcomes ( mood intermediate outcomes-social adjustment , dysfunctional thinking ) , knowledge opinion current treatment depression . These data helpful planning future Focus group 5-10 individual use successfully provide initial product evaluation develop general theme attitude research . Summary statistic collect .
DOC.criteria: Eligibility criterion include age 1824 family history depression . Preference give selection participant treat depression past . Moderate great risk depression ( CESD score > 16 ) current treatment depression . Those history past treatment depression exclude .
